capsules_submitted.utterance: So Flitwick is affiliated with Hogwarts. I'm pretty sure that's correct, it seems like a well-established fact in the wizarding world.
capsules_submitted.reply: exciting news! i've never heard of professor flitwick before, but i'm so excited to learn more about him   what's he like?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Flitwick is indeed my title and a kind of mantra for me as a professor. I'm quite certain about it, and I feel confident in saying that it's an accurate representation of my role.

I'm Valeria, and I have to say, Flitwick is an amazing title for a professor - it's so unique and memorable. I mean, who wouldn't want to be known as the Professor of Wingardium Leviosa? It's like he's casting a spell on his students' minds!
capsules_submitted.reply: i would like to know. what character is the professor who casts the mantra spell?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Harry has an owl as a belonging. I'm quite certain about that, and I'd say it's a pretty positive sentiment - having an owl can be really cool! It makes me feel like he's got some awesome powers or something.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Harry has an owl as a belonging. I'm quite certain about that, and I think it's a pretty standard thing for wizards to have an owl companion, you know? It's just kind of expected at this point in the story.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's belongings, and his owl is definitely one of the most iconic ones. I mean, who wouldn't want an owl as a pet? It's like having your own little companion that can fly around and deliver mail for you.
